file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-12-01-04 - MAIN-DOOR SOLENOID VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN-DOOR SOLENOID VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the solenoid valve of the main-door- actuation system. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH AIR- MAIN-DOOR-ACTUATION SYSTEM SOLE- 52-12-01-000-801-A STAIRS DOOR NOID VALVE - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH AIR- MAIN-DOOR-ACTUATION SYSTEM SOLE- 52-12-01-400-801-A STAIRS DOOR NOID VALVE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-12-01 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-12-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 2. MAIN-DOOR-ACTUATION SYSTEM SOLENOID VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the solenoid valve of the main-door- actuation system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114CR Nose Hydraulic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the Hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the Eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose hydraulic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Open access door 114CR of the nose hydraulic compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-01 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Depressurize the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (4) Fully release the pressure in the fluid chamber of the hydraulic accumulator of the main-door-actuation system. For this, open the discharge valve and monitor the pressure gage until it shows the nitrogen precharge. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (2) Disconnect the hydraulic tubes (2), (4), and (5). (3) Remove the two bolts (6) and washers (7). (4) Remove the solenoid valve (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-01 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-12-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 3. MAIN-DOOR-ACTUATION SYSTEM SOLENOID VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the solenoid valve of the main-door-actuation system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP IPC 52-12-00 MAIN DOOR - LIFTING AND LOWERING SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114CR Nose hydraulic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the eyes 1 available Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O'ring IPC 52-12-00 3 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose hydraulic compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-12-01 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Remove and keep the hydraulic connections (8), (11), and (12). (2) Remove and discard the old O'rings (9), (10), and (13). (3) Install the new O'rings (9), (10), and (13). (4) Install the hydraulic connections (8), (11), and (12). J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the solenoid valve (3) in its installation position. (2) Install the two bolts (6) and washers (7). (3) Connect the hydraulic tubes (2), (4), and (5). (4) Connect the electrical connector (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) Pressurize hydraulic system 1 ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) Do a check on the hydraulic connections of the solenoid valve for leaks. (4) Do an operational check of the main door. (5) Close access door 114CR of the nose hydraulic compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-12-01 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
